title: Synchronization
subject: Java
theory:
When multiple threads share resources (variables), data corruption can happen (Race Condition).

**Synchronization** controls access so only one thread accesses the resource at a time (Monitor Lock).

examples.explanation: Without sync, output could remain 1 due to overwrite.

common_mistakes.correction: Decreases performance significantly. Sync only the critical section.

interview_questions.question: What is Deadlock?
interview_questions.answer: Two threads waiting for each other indefinitely to release locks.

real_world_use_cases.description: Transfer logic must be synchronized so money isn't lost if two transfers happen at once.

exam_notes: Static synchronization locks the Class object.
